issue.title: [BUG] ARIMA model sarimax_kwargs doesn't exist after fit

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
ARIMA model has `**sarimax_kwargs` as init parameters but after fitting the model, they don't exist in the model anymore. `sarimax_kwargs` just returns an empty dictionary.

**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->

```python
import numpy as np
from sktime.datasets import load_airline
from sktime.forecasting.arima import ARIMA

y = load_airline()

model = ARIMA(
    order=(5, 1, 4),
    seasonal_order=(3, 0, 3, 7),
    suppress_warnings=True,
    enforce_stationarity=False,
)
print(model.__dict__)

model.fit(y=y)
print(model.__dict__)
```
**Expected behavior**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->
After fitting, `enforce_stationarity=False`,which is an [sarimax_kwargs parameter](https://alkaline-ml.com/pmdarima/modules/generated/pmdarima.arima.ARIMA.html), should be included in sarimax_kwargs dictionary

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context about the problem here.
-->

**Versions**
<details>

<!--
Please run the following code snippet and paste the output here:
 
from sktime import show_versions; show_versions()
-->
System:
python: 3.8.13
machine: Linux-5.13.0-44-generic-x86_64-with-glibc2.10

Python dependencies:
pip: 22.1.1
setuptools: 62.3.2
sklearn: 1.0
sktime: 0.11.4
statsmodels: 0.13.2
numpy: 1.21.5
scipy: 1.8.1
pandas: 1.3.5
matplotlib: 3.5.2
joblib: 1.1.0
numba: 0.55.2
pmdarima: 1.8.5
tsfresh: None

</details>

<!-- Thanks for contributing! -->

body: Good first issue = "follow the pattern in https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/2731"

issue.title: [ENH] automated init args write to self by `BaseObject`

labels.name: implementing framework
labels.description: Implementing frameworks for new learning tasks

labels.name: refactor
labels.description: Restructuring without changing its external behavior. Neither fixing a bug nor adding a feature.

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
Trying to fix #2733, it is truly atrocious to write long blocks of `self.foo = foo` and then `self.bar = bar` and then `self.supercalifragilistic = supercalifragilistic`.

Should't all estimators just write all `__init__` args to self automatically?

This is now done by `BaseObject`, and writes of parameters to `self` are no longer necessary.

As a proof-of-concept, `AutoETS` is refactored by removing the self writes.

issue.title: [ENH] interface compliance test to ensure sklearn compliance of constructor

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This PR makes the following changes:
* reactivates the `check_constructor` test, which was not executed since the test refactor since we forgot to rename it to start with `test`
*  adds a test to `TestAllEstimators` which checks for interface non-compliance along the lines of the bug #2730, i.e., presence of a `**kwarg` signature element in `Class.__init__`.

Why does having `kwargs` signature elements mean interface non-compliance? `sktime` aims to be compliant with `scikit-learn`, and in particular the nested parameter interface of `scikit-learn`. That assumes that all parameters in the class constructors are explicitly named keyword arguments, and parameters exposed by the `scikit-learn` parameter interface are precisely the named keyword arguments. Passing parameters via unnamed keyword arguments is not caught by the parameter inspection and setter interface of `scikit-learn` or `sktime`. So far, this has been possible without setting off a test, and could lead to unexpected and buggy behaviour, as #2730 shows.

Before the fix #2731 for #2730 is merged, this correctly catches out `ARIMA` as non-compliant.

Relies on the fixes in #2773, of #2733, to test that these are indeed fixes.

issue.title: [BUG] fixing multiple instances of constructor non-compliance with sklearn specifications

labels.name: bugfix
labels.description: Fixes a known bug or removes unintended behavior

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This PR fixes the remaining estimators in #2733.

Most were failing due to `kwargs` instead of explicit arguments in the construtor.
Some were not writing the default value to self.

This has all been fixed, and #2732 should run through.

Additional fixes:
* docstring of `KNeighborsClassifier` corrected
* passing of the `sarimax_kwargs` in `ARIMA` was corrected

issue.title: [BUG] `KNeighborsTimeSeriesClassifier` fails with any algorithm except `brute`

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
`KNeighborsTimeSeriesClassifier` has one of two bugs:

* a docstring that incorrectly claims that an `algorithm` can be set. Currently, it is set to `brute` internally (when calling the sklearn algorithm), no matter what the hyperparameter is.
* failing with algorithms other than `brute`, e.g., `auto` (the sklearn default) when the implementation is fixed to match the docstring.

So, either, the docstring should be corrected and refrain from claiming that more than one algorithm can be used internally; or, the `algorithm` needs to be properly passed through, and the failures with algorithms other than `brute` fixed.

issue.title: [BUG] Added parameters instead of kwargs

#### Reference Issues/PRs

you resolved, so that they will automatically be closed when your pull request

-->
Fixes #2733 for KNeighborsTimeSeriesClassifier

#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you have implemented.
-->
Removes all instances of ```kwargs``` and replaces it with named arguments according to [sklearn classifier](https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.neighbors.KNeighborsClassifier.html)
